Class ScoreSheet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<ScoreRow>
          • ScoreSheet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<ScoreRow>, java.util.Collection<ScoreRow>, java.util.List<ScoreRow>, java.util.RandomAccess
    public class ScoreSheet
extends java.util.ArrayList<ScoreRow>
    List of ScoreRow that contains are the scoring categories and their scores. For example: Threes, Four of a Kind, and Yahtzee are scoring rows.
    See Also:
    ScoreRow, SumAllRow, FixedAmountRow, NumberRow, NumOfAKindRow, FullHouseRow, StraightRow, ChanceRow, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getTotal

        public int getTotal()
        Total score so far; used for display().
        Returns:
        Sum of all ScoreRow.getScore() for each row.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Determine if the score sheet is finished.
        Returns:
        If the score sheet have been filled.

      • display

        public void display()
        Print a visualized ScoreSheet to System.out. Shows the row number followed by ScoreRow.toString().
        See Also:
        ScoreRow.toString()
